thread.title: Thomas Cook and Club Med join forces
thread.title_full: Thomas Cook and Club Med join forces

title: Thomas Cook and Club Med join forces
text:
Save 
Thomas Cook and Club Med have agreed a new “strategic partnership”, which will see the two become “preferred partners” in the European market. 
The resort operator is aiming to achieve €100m of annual sales of holidays through Thomas Cook channels by 2018, representing a 60% increase. 
Closer ties between the two companies has been expected ever since Club Med’s owner, Fosun, took a 5% stake in Thomas Cook in March. 
Thomas Cook’s chief executive Peter Fankhauser said: “We are excited about the opportunities that this strategic partnership with Club Med will bring. 
“Both companies have a long and distinguished history in the travel industry and we very much look forward to driving forward our commitment to delivering high-quality holidays to greater numbers of customers in Europe.” 
Club Med chairman and chief executive Henri Giscard d’Estaing said: “I am delighted by the launch of this new strategic partnership today, which widens to Europe an already prolific collaboration in France, that has been existing for many years. 
“This partnership aims to generate strong sales growth in the European countries where Thomas Cook is present, a real opportunity for both our groups.”
